titleStmt.title: The protestation of the two and twenty divines, for the setling of the church: And the particulars by them excepted against in the liturgie: not that the Book of Common Prayer of the Church of England should be utterly abolished, but purged of all innovations and absurdities. Ordered by them to be printed according to their own directions.

The protestation of the two and twenty divines, for the setling of the church: And the particulars by them excepted against in the liturgie: not that the Book of Common Prayer of the Church of England should be utterly abolished, but purged of all innovations and absurdities. Ordered by them to be printed according to their own directions.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for H. Beck, and are to be sold in the old Baily,

notesStmt.note: Annotation on Thomason copy: The "3" on the imprint date is crossed out; ". March. 10 1642".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
